transportAdvice: Castries is compact enough to explore parts of on foot, though the hilly terrain and heat can make walking tiring; minibuses run frequently along main routes and cover most tourist areas, while taxis are widely available but should have fares agreed in advance.

weather.description: One of the driest and most pleasant months, with warm sunny days and cool evenings ideal for sightseeing.
Dry and comfortable with consistent sunshine, making it a peak time for beach and outdoor activities.
Warm and mostly dry with light breezes, excellent conditions for hiking and water sports.
Temperatures begin to rise and conditions remain largely dry, though brief showers become slightly more possible.
The transition into the wet season brings increased humidity and occasional afternoon showers.
Early wet season with frequent rain showers, though sunshine still breaks through between downpours.
Warm and humid with regular rainfall, and the start of the Atlantic hurricane season warrants monitoring.
Peak of the wet season with heavy and frequent rain; hurricane risk is at its highest this month.
Still firmly in the wet season with significant rainfall and continued elevated hurricane risk.
Rain remains frequent and humidity is high, though the hurricane season begins to wind down toward month's end.
Rainfall gradually decreases as the wet season transitions out, with warm temperatures and improving conditions.
Conditions improve noticeably with drier weather returning, making it a popular month for visitors.
